column2: 1. Do you represent a Cancer Centre or Unit?
column5: 2. Regarding staffing, have you experienced significant reduction in staff numbers in your centre from 26/12/20 onwards?
column6: 2.a. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among junior doctors?
column7: 2.a.i. Please select the overall percentage by which junior doctor numbers were reduced to the nearest percent. For example, if junior doctor staff numbers are reduced from 10 to 7 (i.e. 30%) then select 21-30%.
column8: 2.b. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among GO sub-specialty trainees?
column9: 2.b.i. Please select the overall percentage by which GO sub-specialty trainee numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column10: 2.c. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among consultant staff?
column11: 2.c.i. Please select the overall percentage by which consultant staff numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column12: 2.d. Is this due to COVID related sickness and/or redeployment among CNS staff?
column13: 2.d.i. Please select the overall percentage by which CNS staff numbers were reduced to the nearest percent.
column14: 3. Have you changed the way your MDT function due to COVID?
column15: 3.a. Please indicate all changes to MDT functioning you have implemented.
column16: 3.a.i. If the number of attendees at MDT are reduced please select % reduced
column17: 4. What proportion of your out-patient clinic is currently remote consultation?
column18: 5. Please answer the following questions about the proportion reduction of Gynae Oncology related activity:
column19: 5.1.a. How much has theatre time reduced? - % Reduced
column20: 5.2.a. What is the proportion of surgical cases postponed? - % Reduced
column21: 5.3.a. How much has medical oncology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column22: 5.4.a. How much has clinical oncology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column23: 5.5.a. How much has theatre-based (intrauterine) brachytherapy been reduced? - % Reduced
column24: 5.6.a. How much have outpatient brachytherapy services been reduced? - % Reduced
column25: 5.7.a. How much has radiology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column26: 5.8.a. How much has pathology access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column27: 5.9.a. How much has palliative care access/capacity been reduced? - % Reduced
column28: 5.10.a. How much have your rapid access referrals dropped by? - % Reduced
column29: 5.11.a. How much has your weekly MDT list/workload reduced by? - % Reduced
column30: 6. Please tick all applicable boxes regarding PPE use in theatre:
column31: 7. Please complete the following boxes regarding patient pre-operative prep for major and minor procedures
column32: 7.1.a. Major Procedures - Duration of patient self-isolation prior to procedure
column33: 7.1.b. Major Procedures - Number of COVID swabs prior to procedure
column34: 7.1.c. Major Procedures - Are patients required to be vaccinated for COVID prior to procedure?
column35: 7.2.a. Minor Procedures - Duration of patient self-isolation prior to procedure
column36: 7.2.b. Minor Procedures - Number of COVID swabs prior to procedure
column37: 7.2.c. Minor Procedures - Are patients required to be vaccinated for COVID prior to procedure?
column38: 8. Have you needed to move activity off site to another hospital due to the recent surge in cases? (e.g. Independent sector)
column41: 8.3.a. Moved (theatre based) intrauterine and interstitial brachytherapy
column44: 8.6.a. Not yet moved but are planning to move
column45: 8.7.a. Do you need to go via a central hub or committee to access operating?

column47: 8.a. When operating at different locations than normal, does your normal in-house pathology team report the specimens or are they reported by another team?
column48: 9. Are you working in a COVID-free hospital?
column49: 9.a. If no- Do you have COVID-free/green zones within the non-COVID-free hospital?
column50: 10. Are you undertaking minimal access procedures?

column53: Our trust has been extremely supportive to cancer services. Though overall theatre capacity was reduced, Cancer surgery still continued. We were also offered capacity in the local Nuffield. We managed to get surgeons from local cancer centre to come and operate in our lists for patients who needed tertiary referrals as the local cancer centre theatres were shut for a few weeks. Patients with high BMI and CAH/grade 1 endometrial cancer were initially managed conservatively with Mirena which helped with capacity.

column53: The Christie NHS FT is a green site. it is a Cancer Hub    MDT was already mixed virtual and face to face. Just increased the video link / virtual aspect in order to reduce number of attendees in board rooms and comply with COVID social distancing

column3: East Kent Hospitals University Foundation NHS Trust
column30: FFP3 masks,Visors,Double gloving,Anaesthesia administered in operating theatre itself (rather than in adjoining anaesthetic room)
column53: During the first wave all in March 2020, all activity was moved to a different hospital in the trust. One list per week was also being carried out in the independent sector. During the second wave, we have been working at our usual base hospital with the private wing being used for elective admissions. Although the vaccine is not a must, once the patient has been listed for surgery, then efforts are made to vaccinate the patient prior to procedure. In outpatients, a good proportion of the followups are being done remotely and face to afce reserved for cervix and vulval cancer FU mainly. PIFU has also been introduced. New patients are seen face to face as far as possible.
No brachtherapy service at our centre - referred to The Christie

column53: Oncology lists and clinics have been protected throughout the pandemic and since June we have had any reduction in capacity other than for one week in February. Overall, we have been able to provide a fairly 'normal' service. We do not undertake any diagnostic or benign gynae work except colposcopy

column53: In my humble opinion, I think that the impact of COVID is largely understated especially in ovarian cancer. A way to access this is simply register the number of cases per centre in 2020 and 2021 and compare these numbers with the years 2018 and 2019. My expectation is that we have been operating on 10-20% less patients.
